title: Swiss International Airlines booking error
text: On June 5 at about 9.30am my Swiss International Air lines flight landed in Johannesburg. I had a connecting flight to Durban at 1.40pm (that on my ticket was listed as ‘Swiss Operated By: South African Airways 0555’). At about 10.30am I went to the SAA counter to check in and get my boarding pass. They told me there was a problem on the Swiss Air side and they would contact them as soon as they could. I returned every half hour from then-on but they said they had been unable to contact Swiss Air. By 12-noon several other Swiss Air-booked passengers had arrived with the same issue. Finally at about 12.30 SAA told us that they still had been unable to contact Swiss Air and that the problem was that Swiss Air had failed to secure the bookings. The SAA manager told us that our flight was, in fact, not booked despite what Swiss Air had told us and that if we wanted to get on the flight we would have to buy new tickets. She said we should claim compensation from Swiss Air. I rebooked (as did the others) and the receipt is attached. It cost me R3,828.57 (abouot £160.00)When we were given our boarding passes, the SAA manager said they had discovered that Swiss Air had overbooked and that this was the source of the problem.I contacted Swiss International Airlines and asked for full compensation for the R3,828.57 spent in rectifying the error made by Swiss Air with the booking. They replied that their regulations prevented them from compensating me. The result is that I am out-of-pocket by £160,00 as a direct consequence of a problem with a Swiss International Airlines booking.

title: The worst airline experience ever
text: The worst airline experience ever, I highly recommend anyone to avoid Swiss. We bought tickets Palermo-Zurich-Toronto-Calgary and return Vancouver-Munich-Frankfurt-Palermo. Several weeks later we get an email from Air Canada that the Frankfurt-Palermo flight has been re-scheduled and will depart before our previous flight arrives in Frankfurt. We manage to get through to online assistance and our return flights are rebooked, to what seems an acceptable alternative. After a few more weeks I look into our booking and it turns out now our return flight starts in Toronto, instead of Vancouver. We won’t be anywhere near Toronto. Contacting Swiss through online chat is impossible. Emails are responded by generic answers which indicate that either the person at the other end doesn’t understand the situation at hand, or doesn’t want to understand it. Eventually we manage to find a telephone number in Switzerland and a reluctant lady explains to us that we can either cancel the entire return journey or request refund for the Vancouver-Toronto leg (which went missing from the booking because Air Canada had not confirmed it to Swiss Air. Which, mind you, Swiss Air never thought of informing us!) However, we can only request the cancellation of the return flight after the journey has started - I.e. after we have flown to Canada.We have bought new return flight tickets (with another airline, of course). We hope that there won’t be more announced and uninformed changes or missing legs in our booking that would affect the outgoing journey, but we have zero confidence left in Swiss. We hope to get back money for the flights we paid for but won’t be receiving, because they “lost” part of the booking, but again, we aren’t confident. We don’t understand why we have to finance Swiss for several months for the flights they cancelled on us, and why we cannot be reimbursed for them immediately, as they have caused the cancellation. So, we submitted a request for cancellation and reimbursement of the return flights, but , in line with our other correspondence with Swiss, we have not heard back from them.So, definitely never again and sincerely advising everyone not to buy tickets with Swiss. We hear their alliance partner Lufthansa is much better, so if you need to fly with them, buy through Lufthansa, not Swiss.

title: Absolutely unacceptable treatment – SWISS ignores passenger rights
text: Absolutely unacceptable treatment – SWISS ignores passenger rightsI had one of the most disappointing experiences with SWISS, an airline I once trusted as part of the Star Alliance and a supposedly premium European carrier.During a recent flight, I was obliged to place my handbag in the overhead cabin due to my seat being in an emergency exit row. Upon landing, I discovered that my bag had been damaged by a leaking substance inside the compartment—an incident confirmed in writing by the cabin crew, who witnessed the leak themselves.Despite clear evidence and crew acknowledgment, SWISS refused to take any responsibility, hiding behind vague internal policies. As a so-called “compensation,” they offered me a €100 voucher—not usable unless I buy another ticket with them, which I certainly won’t. This is not compensation. It’s a marketing trap.What is most shocking, however, is the airline’s complete disregard for passenger rights as outlined in European legislation. While Switzerland often aligns itself with EU regulations in the aviation sector, SWISS’s behavior clearly violates the spirit and intent of EU Regulation (EC) No 261/2004 and consumer protection principles. It’s unacceptable that an airline based in a country that wishes to align with the EU chooses to ignore fundamental rights when it suits them.To make matters worse, my checked-in suitcase was also damaged during the same journey, with no resolution or proper response.Fly at your own risk.

title: Review of Swiss Airways – A Deeply Disappointing Experience from Start to Finish
text: I have rarely experienced such atrocious customer service as I did with Swiss Airways. One would expect that an airline marketing itself as “Swiss precision” could at least manage to keep to a schedule and treat paying customers with a minimum of respect – but apparently not.My flight was significantly delayed, and even though I, as the customer, did everything right – showed up on time, followed all procedures, remained patient – I was met with arrogance, indifference, and a total lack of accountability from their side. When it is clearly their fault, you expect at least an apology and some effort to make things right. Instead, I was greeted with cold shrugs, vague excuses, and staff who seemed more interested in passing the problem on than solving it.There was no clear information, no compensation unless you fought tooth and nail for it, and absolutely no willingness to admit their own responsibility. The most absurd part? When you try to ask reasonable questions or seek assistance, you’re treated as a nuisance. It honestly felt like they forgot that I am the customer – and they are the ones who messed up.I travel a lot and have flown with many airlines – including budget ones – but this experience with Swiss Airways was among the worst. Their arrogant attitude and incompetent handling of the situation make them completely unfit as a choice if you value even the slightest bit of reliability or respect.Never again.Swiss Airways gets one star – and that’s only because zero isn’t an option.

title: 📄 Formal Complaint
text: 📄 Formal Complaint – Urgent Double Charge & Unresolved Refund RequestTo: Swiss International Air LinesDear Swiss Air Team,I am writing to file a formal and urgent complaint regarding a duplicate charge for a ticket change I made on May 17, 2025 via your website. Despite repeated contact attempts and having submitted full evidence, I have not received any resolution, and I urgently need this situation resolved.Here’s what happened:On May 17, I attempted to change my flight through your website using my Lloyds Bank card. The website indicated that the transaction had failed, and no amount was deducted at that time. Thinking it hadn’t gone through, I quickly tried again using my Monzo card, and this time the payment was accepted immediately, with the £546.08 debited from Monzo on the same day (May 17).However, to my surprise, two days later, on May 19, Swiss Air also debited the Lloyds card for the same amount (£546.08) — even though:	•	The transaction had been previously marked as failed on your website.	•	The booking was already completed and paid for using Monzo.	•	I had already contacted Lloyds Bank, who confirmed the amount was pending and would only be taken if Swiss Air processed it.This clearly resulted in a double payment for one single booking, which should not have happened.To resolve this, I have:✔ Contacted both Lloyds and Monzo✔ Sent you copies of both bank statements, showing the two charges✔ Tried contacting you via chat and phoneHowever:	•	On the chat, I received no practical help.	•	Over the phone, the customer service agent was rude, unhelpful, and accused me of lying, even though I was calmly explaining the issue and offering full evidence. I was treated with disrespect, and my situation was completely ignored.I submitted all documentation and explained the situation clearly. Despite this, more than two weeks have passed, and I still have not received my refund or any clear response. Your website classifies duplicate charges as urgent, but your team has done absolutely nothing to resolve this.I urgently need this £546.08 refunded immediately, or I will have no choice but to escalate this case by:	•	Filing chargeback disputes with my banks	•	Reporting the issue to the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) or other consumer protection bodies	•	Posting detailed public reviews of this experiencePlease treat this as urgent and issue a refund within 48 hours.Sincerely,

title: I’m genuinely disappointed with my experience with Swiss air
text: I’m genuinely disappointed with my recent experiences with Swiss Air. Over the past few months, nearly every flight I’ve taken with Swiss has been significantly delayed—some by hours, without any clear explanation or proactive communication.The service on board has also taken a hit:Cabin crew often seem indifferent and unhelpful.Food quality has declined drastically (if it’s even served at all on shorter flights).Basic amenities like charging ports or functioning entertainment systems are hit or miss.Rebooking assistance during delays is chaotic and painfully slow, leaving passengers stranded or misinformed.Swiss Air used to be known for reliability and professionalism. Unfortunately, it now feels like just another airline that overpromises and underdelivers. For an airline representing a country known for precision and quality, this is unacceptable.I hope Swiss takes this seriously and makes meaningful improvements. Otherwise, I’ll be forced to reconsider my loyalty.

title: MIA-ZRH LX65 Swiss B777 Economy Class – Disappointing Experience
text: I recently flew in the Economy Class of a Swiss Boeing 777, and unfortunately, it was one of the worst flight experiences I’ve had so far. The seat space is extremely tight — there is barely any legroom, and the rows feel uncomfortably close together, making the long-haul experience very unpleasant.Another surprising downside was the tray table, which was smaller than the food tray itself. This made eating or working during the flight unnecessarily difficult. Overall, the comfort level was well below what I expected from a national carrier like SWISS.Given the reputation of Swiss hospitality and precision, I was genuinely disappointed by the cramped design and lack of passenger comfort on this aircraft. I hope the airline seriously reconsiders the layout and comfort standards for long-haul travelers.

title: Unacceptable service and refusal to pay rightful compensation

text: I would like to place on Record the unprecedented and 5 star treatment we received on-board flight LX0425 from Birmingham to Zurich.My son who was also a passenger had a sudden nose bleed which caused him much distress.The flight attendants were extremely attentive, responsive and displayed alot of care and compassion.They brought him ice to help stop the blood along with plenty of tissue and offered their first Aid tips to help curtail the flow of blood.Thankfully he stopped bleeding after a while.In addition to this, they were also very accommodating when I requested to pray as being a Muslim I had to offer my prayer on-board.These 3 ladies really deserve a huge amount of credit and all the compliments and praise they truly deserve.I managed to get 2 names but all 3 were first Class.Well done Jessica, Eva and flight attendant #3.Thank you very much Swiss.

title: Extremely Disappointing Service
text: Extremely Disappointing ServiceI’ve flown with Swiss Air on several occasions recently—flights that were operated by AirBaltic—and unfortunately, the experience has been consistently poor.Across four separate flights, the service has been shockingly bad. The cabin crew are consistently rude, unfriendly, and lack basic courtesy. They don’t greet passengers, they’re dismissive when spoken to, and at times, their tone feels outright hostile. It's clear that customer care is not a priority.There’s no warmth, no professionalism, and no sense of hospitality. It feels like passengers are just being “processed,” not served. Even small things like offering water or explaining delays are ignored. If you ask questions, expect to be met with impatience or indifference.This is absolutely not the level of service one would expect when booking through Swiss, a company that markets itself as a premium airline. It’s misleading and disappointing.I would strongly recommend avoiding flights operated by AirBaltic under the Swiss name. Unless the service improves dramatically, I will not be flying with them again.

title: An absolute disgrace
text: An absolute disgrace! Even in some developing countries, this wouldn’t happen — and yet here we are, in Switzerland. Asking passengers to show up at 4 a.m. when the baggage belts don’t start running until 4:30? That’s nothing but pure contempt. The check-in counters were open, yes, but with no way to drop off luggage, hundreds of people were left waiting — cold, confused, and frustrated. Where is the coordination with Geneva Airport? This chaos reflects terribly on the quality of service. The paralyzing influence of French unions is obvious — and it needs to stop. We don’t want this creeping into Switzerland. Treating passengers this way is disgraceful and completely unacceptable.

title: Worst company
text: Worst company. I called multiple times to make sure my dog was able to fly with me for both ways. They assured it was fine and even sent me the paperwork to fill in advance. I had to book from another airline to make sure my dog could come back with me. Horrible service. Absolutely do not recommend.

title: If I could rate this 0 stars, I would
text: My baggage was delayed for two days and finally arrived on the third day in absolutely terrible condition. It was scratched all over (not just one or two scratches—it's completely covered), two wheels were missing, and it seemed like someone had intentionally tried to remove the logo.Swiss's partner handling the case told me I should find a repair shop, handle the fixes myself, and they might review the invoice later for reimbursement (though who knows if that's even true). The suitcase was nearly new when I traveled, and now it’s practically ruined. I'm on holiday with no other suitcase.I tried contacting Swiss Support, but they were no help at all. They just gave me canned responses, offering no real solution. To make matters worse, one of their agents (Elisha) literally closed the chat on me when I was pressing for a resolution. Worst airline I've ever traveled and terrible customer service. AVOID IF YOU CAN !

title: REFUND REFUSAL
text: REFUND REFUSALI had booked a flight with SWISS (Booking Reference: LPJD54, Ticket Number: 7242339920255) for travel from Johannesburg to Zurich and onward to Tirana, with return flights scheduled between February 10 and February 17, 2025. February 11, 2025: Your representative confirmed that my refund request had been sent for approval but provided no timeline or further clarity on resolution steps.Issues Faced:   Prolonged Delays: Despite submitting all required documents promptly, including proof of visa rejection, there has been no resolution after more than a month of waiting.Inadequate Communication: Responses from your customer service team have been vague and unhelpful, leaving me uncertain about the status of my refund or when I can expect closure on this matter.Policy Clarity: According to your fare conditions, refunds are permitted before departure in cases of visa rejection with embassy statement evidence.
